main_definition: Forever is an indefinite period of time, often used to describe something lasting endlessly or without limit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be constant and unchanging over a long period
meanings_and_examples.example: His love for her seemed like it would never change; they were in love forever.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Without any end or limit in time
meanings_and_examples.example: She made a promise to him that she will always be there, no matter what, because their friendship felt like it was meant to last forever.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A long period of time without interruption
meanings_and_examples.example: The ancient ruins stood as remnants of a civilization that thrived thousands of years ago, appearing unchanged for ever.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize the idea of permanence or lifelong commitment
meanings_and_examples.example: She vowed to take care of her grandmother forever after she passed away.
